api.name: game_library_service
api.title: Game Library Service
api.description: A microservice allowing us to create add new games, retrieve games, update game information and delete games

create.name: create
create.description: Creates a game in the postgres database.

delete.name: delete
delete.description: Delete a game from the database by ID. Could be used by site admins in case of an upcoming game’s cancellation or a mistake.

index.name: index
index.description: Retrieve a list of all games from the database. Filter will be used to filter out games for searching by values like name. Can be used to retrieve a game’s ID to use the Show endpoint.

show.name: show
show.description: Retrieve and show a game from the database. Will be used to show a game’s full profile when on the game’s page on the site.

update.name: update
update.description: Update a game’s fields in the database. Would be used if new information on the game was added such as finalized release dates, ports to new platforms etc.

genre.description: An array of genres the game falls under

name.description: Name of the game

platforms.description: A list of Platforms the game has been released on. Consoles/PC etc.

location.description: Location of the newly created game
location.example: Qui deserunt maxime sequi ut deleniti.

id.description: ID of the game in the Postgres database

fault.description: Is the error a server-side fault?

id.description: ID is a unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

message.description: Message is a human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

name.description: Name is the name of this class of errors.

GameResponseBody.title: Mediatype identifier: game; view=default

genre.description: An array of genres the game falls under

id.description: ID of the game in the Postgres database

name.description: Name of the game

platforms.description: A list of Platforms the game has been released on. Consoles/PC etc.

GameResponseBody.description: A game is a collection of values representing a game in the database. (default view)

GameResponseBodyCollection.title: Mediatype identifier: game; type=collection; view=default
GameResponseBodyCollection.description: GameCollectionResponseBody is the result type for an array of GameResponseBody (default view)

filter.description:
Filter for filtering list of games returned. 
The following filters are supported:
| Filter | Description | Allowed Operator | Behavior | Example |
| --- | ---| --- | --- | --- |
| name | Filters on the game name | co | Contains - The entire operator value must be a substring of the attribute value for a match. |  name co 'Remaster' |
|	|	| eq | Equal - The attribute and operator values must be identical for a match. | name eq 'Super Mario 64'  |
* All operators are case-sensitive and only lowercase is allowed. 
		e.g: 
			valid	: eq
			invalid : EQ

* Filters can be combined using the and/or logical operator. 
		e.g: (name co 'Mario' or name eq 'Super Mario 64')
	
* When used as a query string, the filter parameter value must be URL encoded.		 
		e.g: ?filter=(name%20co%20'Mario'%20or%20name%20eq%20'Super Mario 64')

	When using cURL, the same expression can be URL encoded as follows: 
		$ curl -i -H "$AUTH_HEADER" {$BASE_URL}/games \
			-G --data-urlencode "filter=(name co 'Mario' or name eq 'Super Mario 64')"

id.description: The ID of the game

genre.description: An array of genres the game falls under

id.description: ID of the game in the Postgres database

platforms.description: A list of Platforms the game has been released on. Consoles/PC etc.
